channel.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
channel.description:
Hello Guys, I was wondering if there was a way to make a item be able to degrade in a certain amount of time of wearing it? __________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Also, is there a way for that same item to poison you if you wear it, then take it off? Like, if you have it wielded, you are not poisoned. But if you unequipped it you get poisoned until you wield it again?
____ Last few times I posted this, I got no feedback nor help. Could someone please help me with this?

AtomicInt_:

No, Arham, the variable is ‘damage’ he’s placing that before the integer damage is declared.

Ffs, the text when quoted got me lool

item.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:12, topic:459658”]I’d assume 450 server cycle periods.

1 period consists of 600 ms, so 270000 milliseconds, or 4.5 minutes.[/quote]Oh okay, thank you!
And thanks Pnut, but I found it already. And yes, i’m actually surprised everyone is being so helpful today. Thank you all.
Here’s my current code for it:

if(c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] == 13663 && c.degradeTime == 450) {// Degrade. c.getItems().wearItem(-1, 1, 5); // remove the equiped item c.sendMessage("SECRET :3"); // send a message c.degradeTime = 0; // put the degrade number back to 0 so it can degrade again @ 500 }
Quick question, “c.degradeTime =0;” puts the degrade at 500?? What does this mean, it just reverts the time back next time you have the wielded item?

Alright, Next part. I think that will work.
Is it possible to make it where when you buy a ITEM from a store/player it poisons your character, until you wield a certain item?(13663)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

I looked at an old PI I have collecting dust on my desktop.

The wearItem method removes whatever is currently in a specified slot and swaps it with something else. So like you’re using a crystal bow and it degrades on you, it would instantly swap and remain in your weapon slot.

It seems that delta and PI share this method, so try using this:
c.playerEquipment[c.playerShield] != xxxx
or
playerEquipment[.playerShield] != xxxx

the c. part refers to this.c = Client;
so depending where you are placing the code you may or may not need it.

EDIT: You posted before me, looks like you’re getting it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I’d assume 450 server cycle periods.

1 period consists of 600 ms, so 270000 milliseconds, or 4.5 minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:6, topic:459658”]I have it set so that if you’re not wearing it, you will be poisoned. I’ll show you the difference:

This is if the player doesn’t have it equipped:
!playerEquipment[playerChest]

This is if the player does have it equipped:
playerEquipment[playerChest]

The difference is the exclamation point, which means “does not” in the java language.

Now, to answer your question, I cannot tell you if “rEquipment[playerShield]” would be the correct method or not, like I said I am unfamiliar with Project Insanity. But “rEquipment” just doesn’t ring a bell, if I saw the PI method I’m sure I would be able to tell due to seeing methods so many times within help topics.[/quote]

lol you cannot do that with an integer value.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

I have it set so that if you’re not wearing it, you will be poisoned. I’ll show you the difference:

This is if the player doesn’t have it equipped:
!playerEquipment[playerChest]

This is if the player does have it equipped:
playerEquipment[playerChest]

The difference is the exclamation point, which means “does not” in the java language.

Now, to answer your question, I cannot tell you if “rEquipment[playerShield]” would be the correct method or not, like I said I am unfamiliar with Project Insanity. But “rEquipment” just doesn’t ring a bell, if I saw the PI method I’m sure I would be able to tell due to seeing methods so many times within help topics.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]- Items Degrade within time. *CLOSED*
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:2, topic:459658”]I know how to do the degrading, but I also know there are tutorials for this.

For the poisoning, are you going to have this happen within a certain area or what?
I’m not familiar with Project Insanity honestly so I’ll just give random methods, you should be able to convert them easily.

[code=java]
//make sure to define this boolean
public boolean inInWherever(){
if((absX >= xxxx&& absX <= xxxx && absY >= xxxx && absY <=xxxx))
return true;
else
return false;
}

//Now, you’ll place your restrictions
if(isInWherever && !playerEquipment[playerChest] == xxxx){//just using the chest as an example
castOnPlayer.poisoned = true;//this is the poison method for delta, you’ll have to use your the PI method of course
messageMethod(“You must wear whatever…”):
}
[/code][/quote]Okay I see what you are saying. But I do not want it to be in a certain area also, you have it to where if I wear that item, it poisons me.
Okay Okay Okay, Lets start with this. Let’s just make this item degradable and not worry about anything else yet.
This item is a Shield so would the code be:

rEquipment[playerShield]? or is that wrong.

Read full topic
